dcterms:description: The Arcade Learning Environment (ALE) is an evaluation platform for general agents, providing a suite of Atari 2600 games for reinforcement learning research.
dcterms:title: Atari Learning Environment (ALE)

dcterms:description: Craftax is a lightning-fast benchmark for open-ended reinforcement learning, designed to facilitate the evaluation of RL algorithms in a challenging environment.
dcterms:title: Craftax

dcterms:description: The Hanabi challenge is a new frontier for AI research, focusing on cooperative multi-agent reinforcement learning in a card game setting.
dcterms:title: Hanabi

dcterms:creator: Leemon Baird
dcterms:description: Baird's Counterexample is a challenging domain for reinforcement learning, specifically designed to demonstrate the difficulties of off-policy methods.
dcterms:title: Baird's Counterexample

dcterms:description: DeepSea is a domain used to evaluate reinforcement learning algorithms, particularly focusing on environments where rewards are sparse.

dcterms:description: Smax is an improved benchmark for cooperative multi-agent reinforcement learning, designed to facilitate the evaluation of algorithms in a multi-agent setting.
dcterms:title: Smax
